content:
The goal and assumptions at this line are no longer related to the proof. I can't recall if this is the same problem that I ran into a while ago that there was a bug report for or not, and I can't find my old message. It persists on restarting the Lean server and Visual Code.
Screenshot-from-2023-04-07-12-08-37.png
Is there a way to search all public conversations I participated in?
If you start typing your name in the search bar you'll see an option to get there (at least assuming you're using a web browser, I'm not sure about the mobile app).

I think that just narrows it to the messages I alone sent? Is there a way to narrow it to all messages sent (including by other users) in a conversation I sent a message in? Or to get a list of the topics I started?
The latter might be the most useful.
I don't know how to do this from the web. But if it's important then you can definitely do it using the python API.
Ok, it does appear to be this bug: https://github.com/leanprover-community/lean/issues/468
Kayla Thomas has marked this topic as resolved.
